pr_title: Move QueuedThreadPool from executors to jetty

timeline.message: rename to be more specific before introducing new module
reinstante QueuedThreadPool so that the executor functionality is covered.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this needs to be a separate InstrumentationModule, and can glob onto the existing jetty InstrumentationModule
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
Why not keep them separate?  Is it a problem to do that?  If we do combine them, we'll want to rename the existing module then probably from JettyHandlerInstrumentationModule to just JettyInstrumentationModule or something because it will no longer be handler specific.
I can make that change, just not clear on the advantage.  I'm also uncertain about bringing over the contextStore() override since it doesn't necessarily seem to apply to jetty handlers.
replies.author: breedx-splk

replies.bodyText:
the advantage of having a single InstrumentationModule is that we know either all or none of the instrumentation will be applied (not muzzled), which reduces the number of states we have to think about when developing or troubleshooting
the contextStore() is ok, at the InstrumentationModule level it's just a combination of all context stores needed for instrumentation in the module
replies.author: trask

timeline.author: trask
trask

timeline.message: move JettyQueuedThreadPoolModule into the other module.
